      [The ACM Full-Text Collection] vs. [The ACM Guide to Computing Literature]: The ACM Full-Text Collection are articles ever sponsored or published by ACM along with a set of vetted, hosted content from select publishers. All of this content is made available directly from The ACM Digital Library. The ACM Guide to Computing Literature is the most comprehensive bibliographic database focused exclusively on the field of computing. This database includes all of the content from The ACM Full-Text Collection along with citations, and links where possible, to all other publishers in computing.

        In the response to my call for this editorial, one of the SEs wrote: I predict that twenty or thirty years down the road, few people would mention fintech or big data, just like very few research studies would mention e-commerce today.         RQ4: Why do automatic machine learning models misclassify some protection-impacting changes?

        We apply four different machine learning algorithms: logistic regression, Naive Bayes, decision tree, and Random Forest.

        RQ4: Why do automatic machine learning models misclassify some protection-impacting changes? Motivation.
